title: The ocb rule
excerpt: The Old Country Buffet by my house has an abundance of food options, almost all of which are either too sweet, salty or bland to be worth consumption.

children.text: The Old Country Buffet by my house has an abundance of food options, almost all of which are either too sweet, salty or bland to be worth consumption.
In fact, of the all-you-can-eat establishments I've been too in the past, I don't think I've once found anything worth the caloric withdrawal. Smorgasbord offerings rarely do.
Which highlights an important point: if it's not worth it, don't eat it (or buy it).
